alert.note: Alert for Geauga; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 6:13PM EDT until August 24 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Geauga and Lake. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in urban and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen near Madison. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Painesville, Chardon, Fairport Harbor, Mentor, Madison, Middlefield, Perry, Burton, Mentor-On-The-Lake, Kirtland, Parkman, Huntsburg, Claridon, Montville, North Perry, Thompson, Kirtland Hills, Grand River, Aquilla and North Madison. Be especially careful if traveling on Interstate 90 or Route 2. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
